creator: kelch@pobox.com
text:
When trying to use log4j from two separate servlet contexts in Orion (and
therefore requiring both to be configured separately since no static variables
are shared between contexts), the second context to attempt to configure log4j
gets the following errors.  We're using a DOM node to configure log4j.  NOTE:
The Barracuda project also has the same problem but they didn't report it here.

Orion/1.5.2 initialized
log4j:WARN Failed to set property file to value
"./log/newellrubbermaid-intra-sandbox/jtransit.log". object is not an
instance of declaring class
log4j:WARN Failed to set property conversionPattern to value "%t %-5p
%c{2} - %m%n". object is not an instance of declaring class
log4j:WARN File option not set for appender [JTRANSITLogger].
log4j:WARN Are you using FileAppender instead of ConsoleAppender?
log4j:ERROR No output stream or file set for appender named
[JTRANSITLogger].

creator: kelch@pobox.com
text: Oh, important: I should note this happens under JDK 1.4.

Chris,

Does the bug persist with log4j 1.2? Does the problem occur under JDK 1.3?
creator: ceki@apache.org
ceki@apache.org
text:
This apparently a JDK 1.4 bug. As such, I am closing this report.

See http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=log4j-user&m=102330754302033&w=2
